item.title: Music Is Being Eaten by the Cloud
item.description: The other day I tried to put my music collection onto some kind of NAS so I could use it from any computer on my network. It turned out, that while it wasn’t much of a problem finding a server to index and serve the music directory over the network, finding a client that is not ancient was more trouble. Ironically, Apple’s own DAAP protocol is not supported by anything produced by Apple anymore.
